Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Based on the provided information, several sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented by various entities mentioned in the text. Some examples include:

1. Introducing a managed travel program to track emissions more accurately (company).
2. Implementing a comprehensive managed travel program that allows tracking of emissions more accurately (company).
3. Completing the first full year of composting in the Boston office, diverting approximately 50 pounds of food waste from landfills (company).
4. Encouraging stewardship by tying executive performance bonuses with water conservation (corporate citizenship).
5. Integrating water considerations into the mergers and acquisitions (MA) due diligence process (investor perspective).
6. Describing a project where a company is working towards returning more water to local aquifers than they consume (net positive water goals).
7. Assessing the environmental and climate-related initiatives of companies in environmental, social, and governance (ESG) analysis and engaging with corporate managements to promote sustainable practices.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided text, the environmental impact metrics being reported include climate-related risks, tracking of emissions reductions, evaluation of climate-related goals, assessment of the quality of climate governance approaches, and exposure to climate risks. These metrics aim to provide insights into the environmental performance of companies and help investors, consumers, and regulators make informed decisions.

source.content: Reporting Initiative GRI or the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures TCFD A  study underscored the value of consistently reported data Researchers looking at health and safety data disclosed by a random sample of 50 publicly traded Fortune  companies found more than 24 different metrics The study concluded that the metrics and methodologies by which they were calculated were unclear and could be confusing Also companies would report the same metrics but with different units of measurement As a result the data was deemed to have limited usefulness1 Reporting framework consolidation also supports expanded ESG reporting For example 90 percent of SP  companies published a corporate sustainability report CSR in  up from 20 percent in  Furthermore the number of companies following the TCFD framework jumped by 1 or 62 percent to 2 from  to  Beyond the benefits for investors consumers and regulators improving corporate ESG data reporting is beneficial for corporate and

environmental social and governance ESG reporting rules It is a goal that investors consumers and regulators also seek While corporate sustainability reporting experienced tremendous growth over the past decade concerns among market participants persisted Corporate executives complained of reporting fatigue; citing too many requests for ESG information surveys to complete and frameworks to follow Meanwhile investors consumers and regulators acknowledged that ESG metrics that are reported according to differing standards can make it more difficult to accurately compare sustainability data They advocated for broad adherence to standardized reporting methodologies such as those created by the Value Reporting Foundation VRF formerly the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board or SASB the Global Reporting Initiative GRI or the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures TCFD A  study underscored the value of consistently reported data Researchers looking at health and safety data

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made multiple public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. Some notable examples include their status as a "Best for the World" honoree in the Customer Governance and Changemaker categories (Breckinridge), their commitment to donating 1% of their gross revenues to charity annually (Breckinridge), their membership in the Net Zero Asset Managers initiative (NZAMi) dedicated to supporting the goal of net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 202 or sooner, and their involvement in various other initiatives such as America Is All In, TCFD, and others. Additionally, they have a Sustainability Committee composed of employees from different levels within the organization, demonstrating their dedication to making sustainability an integral part of their operations and decision-making processes.

source.content: managers committed to supporting the goal of net zero greenhouse gas GHG emissions by  or sooner in line with global efforts to limit warming to 15 degrees Celsius B Corps are for-profit companies certified by the nonprofit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance accountability and transparency They seek to use business as a force for good Breckinridge is a  “Best for the World” honoree in the Customer Governance and Changemaker categories[2] Breckinridge’s aim to be a better corporate citizen extends beyond our goals to improve our own business practices We are also committed to the environment and communities in which we live work and invest Charitable giving volunteerism and sustainability-aligned sponsorship form the foundation of our community outreach efforts Annually we aim to donate 1 percent of our gross revenues match individual employee giving up to 1 and offer employees two company-sponsored volunteer days and one personal volunteer day

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, there are annual and quarterly reports detailing these commitments. In summary, the annual report highlights the company's progress towards achieving various targets such as reducing greenhouse gas emissions, engaging with companies, and preserving capital. Quarterly reports provide updates on the company's efforts to integrate environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors into its investment process, as well as its participation in industry initiatives focused on promoting net-zero emissions goals. Additionally, the company maintains a dedicated section on its website providing detailed information on its commitments, strategies, and achievements related to sustainable investing and ESG integration.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Based on the given context, there isn't any mention of specific community or social events organized to fulfill these commitments. However, it is mentioned that Breckinridge has various programs and initiatives aimed at supporting diverse communities, such as the Ambassador Program, volunteering opportunities, and the DEI Deep Dives series. These programs contribute to fulfilling the company's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).

source.content: By providing time and money through volunteering and charitable giving we believe we’re building stronger communities and engaging employees to connect around their shared values The pandemic hit our communities hard and we shifted to more monetary giving while we prioritized the health and safety of our employees during  and  We were thrilled to get our boots back on the ground in  and increased our total time volunteered to almost pre-pandemic levels One of the ways we did this was through our Ambassador Program which is intended to make a more significant impact with a smaller number of nonprofit organizations Our employee-led teams build relationships with our four main nonprofit partners The Trustees of Reservations The Home for Little Wanderers Somerville Village The REAL Program and Pine Street Inn The teams are charged with creating meaningful volunteer events for our staff and partners allocating the firm’s charitable budget to the organizations’ key initiatives and educating

Pine Street Inn The teams are charged with creating meaningful volunteer events for our staff and partners allocating the firm’s charitable budget to the organizations’ key initiatives and educating staff about the nonprofits and their missions In addition to strengthening our communities volunteering and a passion for giving brings our employees together for team building and connection around a common cause When employees feel their organization supports causes close to their hearts we believe they’re more engaged and productive at work which ultimately ensures better outcomes for our clients Several Breckinridge employees sit on community nonprofit boards By volunteering either during their personal time or using their designated volunteer time off these employees provide leadership and the value of their experiences to organizations doing important work in our communities They bring to our offices insights and inspiration that helps our organization as we chart new community

On the education front our DEI Deep Dives series continued in  facilitated by our director of corporate sustainability During our deep dives groups of employees review reflect on and discuss content provided for specific DEI-relevant topics During the year we introduced conversations around intersectionality and people with disabilities While these sessions are not mandatory we see strong attendance including among leadership with lively conversation and positive feedback We also began monthly DEI Denim Days During these campaigns we provide information on a diversity-related topic and highlight related community nonprofits Employees learn about the topic and can choose to donate to the community service organization and wear jeans in the office for the week In addition to raising awareness we generated financial support for local nonprofits totaling more than 6 since the program commenced in June  We conducted our second compensation study in  to help address wage gaps for all roles

in investments in Black Indigenous and People of Color BIPOC-businesses Another initiative created a 30 billion racial equity lending goal with 13 billion of the goal disbursed already largely through affordable housing loans A third bank committed 30 billion in new financing by  for single family and affordable homes for Black and Latino households in rural and urban areas The pledge also targets assisting one million people to access low-fee checking and savings accounts and 2 billion in philanthropy for Black and Latino nonprofit organizations We discussed participation in Project REACh Roundtable for Economic Access and Change sponsored by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency OCC during one engagement session The initiative brings together leaders from the banking industry national civil rights organizations business and technology to identify and reduce barriers that keep underserved and minority communities from full equal and fair participation in the economy Project

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided information, it appears that Breckinridge offers various investment solutions and services tailored to meet their clients' investment goals. Their integrated operating system houses proprietary software and custom technological solutions designed to streamline and enhance their investment processes. Additionally, they utilize advanced trading technology to better manage trades and match opportunities with portfolio needs. Lastly, they have experienced professionals in different areas such as hardware support, network and infrastructure operations, and consultant relations, who contribute to the overall success of the company.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the conversation, there are multiple opportunities available through the Lighted Pathways program. These opportunities include internships in various departments within companies such as Breckinridge, which focus on areas like asset management, financial markets, marketing, human resources, administration, portfolio management, trading, and risk management. Additionally, the program seeks applicants with backgrounds in science, mathematics, engineering, and even marketing, human resources, administration, portfolio management, trading, and risk management.

source.content: Diego Aviles UNCF vice president Development Northeast Division The program was created to increase the number of African Americans in asset management and develop pipelines of diverse talent coming from Historically Black Colleges and Universities HBCUs and other minority serving institutions to Boston This program is all about providing a curated pathway for talented students to be successful In addition to matching corporate sponsors with qualified student interns UNCF and our corporate sponsors support Lighted Pathways participants in several ways Along with providing internships corporate partners meet with students to provide feedback on their resumes and to coach them on interviewing skills It includes guidance on how begin to build a resume with limited experience Tips include highlighting transferrable skills such as team building on resumes  Dominica Nick you brought the program to our attention at Breckinridge What is our role Nicholas Elfner Breckinridge co-head of

Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are multiple events organized throughout the year to cater to different aspects of career development. Some of these events include:

1. Job Fairs: Regular job fairs are held where potential candidates can interact with company representatives, learn about available positions, and submit their applications. These fairs often target diverse talent pools, including those from HBCUs and other minority-serving institutions.
2. Webinars: Periodic webinars are hosted on various topics relevant to career development, such as resume writing, interview skills, and navigating the job search process. These webinars are open to both current employees and external candidates.
3. Workshops: The company organizes workshops focused on developing specific skills, such as presentation, negotiation, and time management. These workshops are designed for employees at different stages of their careers, from new hires to senior leaders.
4. Training Programs: Customized training programs are offered to employees to enhance their technical and soft skills. These programs may be tailored to specific departments or roles within the company.
5. Mentorship Program: A formal mentorship program has been launched to connect junior employees with experienced professionals. This program aims to foster personal and professional growth through regular check-ins, goal setting, and guidance on career advancement.

source.content: been working towards broader access to learning and development opportunities to support growth and promotion within the firm In  we sent several female employees to the Massachusetts Conference for Women which provided inspiration skill building and networking to encourage personal and professional growth In  we’re launching a Management Essentials course that will focus on new managers and individual contributors who have exhibited leadership skills in their roles We’ve also planned an Executive Presence and Personal Brand workshop that will take client facing individuals at various levels and give them group and individualized training to enhance their presence and impact in professional settings Finally we developed a mentorship program that we will pilot in  with plans for an official firm-wide introduction in  This program is intended to build connections increase visibility of individual contributors and develop leadership skills for mentors As reported last year we developed a

highlighting transferrable skills such as team building on resumes  Dominica Nick you brought the program to our attention at Breckinridge What is our role Nicholas Elfner Breckinridge co-head of research We provide feedback on student resumes and their LinkedIn profiles We offer guidance to help them prepare for an interview That includes having some answers to common questions in their back pocket When one student was visibly nervous we helped him prepare a message on why he wants to be in the industry What’s special about this program is our ability to be hands on We verified student academic transcripts and made sure they matched resumes It felt like being a student advisor Diego One challenge is convincing prospective interns to come to Boston For students from across the country who have never been to the city it can be perceived as a foreign or even hostile environment There’s a narrative that the city is not very welcoming or inclusive  To help overcome that the program’s

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result:
Based on the provided context, it seems like there haven't been any specific recent publications, research findings, or introduced technologies mentioned directly. However, some notable events and developments can still be inferred from the text:

* The Innovation Gala Awards dinner took place on December 12, where the winners were announced (source: [2])
* Breckinridge sponsored a table at the Innovation Gala Awards dinner on December 12 where the winners were announced (source: [6])
* Rob Bailey discussed the influence of investors, corporate efforts to address ESG risks, potential solutions for climate risk, and other topics related to sustainability and climate change in his interview (source: [7])
* Oggie Sosa, CIO of Breckinridge, spoke about their approach to climate risk assessment while conducting investment research (source: [8])
* There has been a significant increase in foreign investors buying US corporate credit, which is approaching a new record high (source: [9], [10])
* Peter Coffin, president of Breckinridge, emphasized the importance of considering climate risk when evaluating municipal bonds (source: [11])
* Nick Elfner, co-head of research at Breckinridge, commented on various trends and developments in the US corporate leveraged loan market (source: [12]), the investment grade bond market (source: [13]), and the municipal bond market (source: [14]).

Research & Innovation.question: What research grants or innovation awards have been recently distributed?
Research & Innovation.result:
Based on the provided context, it seems like several research grants and innovation awards have been recently distributed. Here are some examples mentioned in the text:

1. Best for the World Lists (December 12): Winners of this prestigious award were announced at the Innovation Gala Awards dinner on December 12. This list recognizes companies that excel in creating positive social and environmental impact.
2. CIO Industry Innovation Awards (December 12): These awards were presented at the magazine's annual Innovation Gala. Sponsored by Breckinridge, these awards recognize industry leaders who demonstrate exceptional innovation within their respective fields.
3. ESG Investing Awards (May 31): Announced on May 31, these awards aim to identify and celebrate the best companies involved in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) investing globally. Shortlists for each award category were released in December before the final winners were selected by an independent panel of judges.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Based on the provided information, the organization is working closely with several nonprofit partners through its Ambassador Program. These main nonprofit partners include:

1. The Trustees of Reservations
2. The Home for Little Wanderers (Somerville Village)
3. The REAL Program
4. Pine Street Inn

These partner organizations benefit from employee-led teams who create meaningful volunteer events, allocate the firm's charitable budget, and support key initiatives. Additionally, the organization mentioned participating in the Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials (PCAF), enabling them to assess and disclose greenhouse gas emissions of loans and investments.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Yes, there have been several joint events, projects, and initiatives involving various stakeholders such as employees, nonprofit partners, and external organizations. Some notable examples include:

1. Ambassador Program: This employee-led program involves working closely with the firm's four main nonprofit partners (The Trustees of Reservations, The Home for Little Wanderers Somerville Village, The REAL Program, and Pine Street Inn) to create meaningful volunteer events for staff and partners, allocate the firm's charitable budget to the organizations' key initiatives, and educate participants about the causes they are supporting.
2. DEI Deep Dives & DEI Denim Days: These joint initiatives involve collaboration between employees, leadership, and the Director of Corporate Sustainability. DEI Deep Dives consist of monthly sessions where small groups of employees come together to discuss diversity, equity, and inclusion topics, while learning about related community nonprofits and choosing to donate to those organizations. DEI Denim Days are monthly campaigns where employees can wear jeans in the office and contribute financially to selected community service organizations, helping to raise awareness and generate funds for local nonprofits.
3. Volunteer Time: Throughout the year, employees have dedicated their time to various volunteer activities organized by the firm and its nonprofit partners. These events aim to strengthen communities and engage employees in shared values, demonstrating the importance of collective effort towards a common goal.

source.content: By providing time and money through volunteering and charitable giving we believe we’re building stronger communities and engaging employees to connect around their shared values The pandemic hit our communities hard and we shifted to more monetary giving while we prioritized the health and safety of our employees during  and  We were thrilled to get our boots back on the ground in  and increased our total time volunteered to almost pre-pandemic levels One of the ways we did this was through our Ambassador Program which is intended to make a more significant impact with a smaller number of nonprofit organizations Our employee-led teams build relationships with our four main nonprofit partners The Trustees of Reservations The Home for Little Wanderers Somerville Village The REAL Program and Pine Street Inn The teams are charged with creating meaningful volunteer events for our staff and partners allocating the firm’s charitable budget to the organizations’ key initiatives and educating

On the education front our DEI Deep Dives series continued in  facilitated by our director of corporate sustainability During our deep dives groups of employees review reflect on and discuss content provided for specific DEI-relevant topics During the year we introduced conversations around intersectionality and people with disabilities While these sessions are not mandatory we see strong attendance including among leadership with lively conversation and positive feedback We also began monthly DEI Denim Days During these campaigns we provide information on a diversity-related topic and highlight related community nonprofits Employees learn about the topic and can choose to donate to the community service organization and wear jeans in the office for the week In addition to raising awareness we generated financial support for local nonprofits totaling more than 6 since the program commenced in June  We conducted our second compensation study in  to help address wage gaps for all roles

committee for the Brookings Institute’s Hutchins Center on Fiscal and Monetary Policy Annual Municipal Finance Conference He is on the advisory board for the Journal of Impact and ESG Investing and a member of the steering committee of the Intentional Endowment Network Tim serves as the President of Ridley College’s US Scholarship Foundation He received a BA from Hobart College and holds a Series 65 license My primary role is on the consultant relations team Additionally I recently assumed the role of chairing our Sustainability Committee which I am very excited about because it’s particularly relevant to my client-facing responsibilities Within consultant relations I spend a lot time educating clients on what sustainable investing is and trying to overcome preconceived notions that still exist about responsible investing At Breckinridge we really believe that sustainability is who we are as a firm but I do not think you can achieve this without constantly having that conversation

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The collaboration between Breckinridge and other firms or individuals can lead to several mutually beneficial objectives and outcomes. These may include sharing knowledge and expertise, fostering innovation, expanding market reach, enhancing product offerings, improving operational efficiency, and promoting sustainable business practices. By working together, both parties can achieve common goals while leveraging each other's strengths and resources. Ultimately, successful collaborations can result in increased profitability, competitive advantage, and positive societal impact.

to make a team more efficient What I like about technology here is that we have a hand in it We are the true architects of what we want the technology to do for us Technology has dramatically evolved in my time here at the firm and it is critical to our portfolio management process It enables us to efficiently and effectively manage over 10 client portfolios and allows us to focus our time on what matters most “Before Breckinridge I was a trader but I had stepped out of the industry for seven years to care for my four children Despite that absence Breckinridge never had reservations about giving me the opportunity to re-enter the workforce when I was ready and I think that says a lot about the firm From the start I wasn’t limited in how I could contribute to the company I began as a trader in  and made the transition to portfolio management in  I’m grateful to be part of a company that values hard work and encourages internal mobility “To me Breckinridge’s culture is innovative

net zero goals Co-Head of Consultant Relations assists in setting overall consultant relations and business development strategy and manages many of the firm’s key relationships At Breckinridge there is no separation between business development and relationship management and I think having this consistent point of contact has helped us develop strong long-lasting relationships Co-Head of Consultant Relations assists in setting overall consultant relations and business development strategy and manages many of the firm’s key relationships We don’t just want to meet our clients’ needs we want to anticipate their next need and their next question I’ve been with Breckinridge for over 15 years and I never would have imagined that we would have been able to put as many ideas into practice as we have Considering the Municipal Bond Market Implications of ETF Asset Growth
